column5: Wow, seems like its been forever!! We had a really busy spring and we moved to a larger property just north of Barrie and I'm loving it!! I can finally put my boat in the garage which is super exciting.  Did a few early May speck trips with some decent success, but nothing spectacular. Got out to Couchiching for pike opener last weekend.  Fishing was tough but managed to get into a few.  Most were just little hammerhandles but got a couple decent fish on a Strike Zone Swammer swimbait.    Saturday, I took a friend up to Muskoka for opener.  Fishing was tough again, we got some really good fish but we had to work hard for them.  Sunny, flat calm weather mixed with an insane amount of boat traffic didnt help our cause. Jerkbaits and swimbaits did the damage for us.  Even got a 40 inch musky, which I've never caught out of this lake before.          Thanks for reading
Nice Fishin !!!  Thanks for the report.   Paul
Wow! Great fish!!!! I'm very envious
Nice fish Steve!!
wow monster gators
Nice Pike. I can't wait to get out for some pike. Leaving in two weeks.

it does seems like it's been quite a while since I saw one of your reports!!  Great fish, and even better jersey  Damn I wish i have one!!

Awesome gators   Those are solid fish, and such great weather as well. WTG  I think I recognize that spot in the third photo, I remember seeing that spot when I was a teenager   lol

Nice fish, I have been out all weekend on muskoka lake I have had pretty good luck no large jumbos though largest was 30". How deep where you getting them? and did you catch them near Gravenhurst by any chance.  o and where is the musky pic?
Ive been on this forum long enough to not post an oos musky photo lol We got them as shallow as 3ft and as deep as 14
